intro: Strobilanthes tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan flame flower, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames, with vibrant orange to red bracts. Its flowering period occurs during the short growing season in late summer to early autumn. Strobilanthes tibetica is notable for its ecological importance in alpine ecosystems and its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
